revised_title: Experimental Study of Alternating Current Dynamo-Electric Machines
tldr: This article presents an experimental study of alternating current dynamo-electric machines, focusing on the current induced in the coils and magnets by the varying currents and positions of the armature. The author demonstrates that these induced currents affect the machine's performance, leading to a reduction in the average magnetism of the magnets. The study provides insights into the behavior of alternating current machines and contributes to the understanding of armature reaction and electromotive force.
